subject: Productivity
title: The Rise of MBA Culture
description: A fast breakdown of The Rise of MBA Culture for builders.

hook.text: Harvard Business School opened in 1908. Management became something you could study, not just do.

buildup.text: MBA programs taught frameworks: strategy, finance, marketing, and operations as formal disciplines.

discovery.text: By the 1960s, MBA graduates dominated corporate leadership. Professional managers replaced founders.

twist.text: Critics argued MBAs valued spreadsheets over intuition. Managing by numbers missed the human element.

climax.text: The debate continues: does management education create better leaders or just better analysts?

punchline.text: Management became a profession. The verdict is still out.

quiz.question: When did Harvard Business School open?
